required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Blood Coagulation Abnormalities in COVID-19 (Corona Virus Disease-19) Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Blood Coagulation Abnormalities in COVID-19 Patients and Correlation With Severity

brief_summary.textblock: The role of the coagulation parameters in predicting the severity of COVID-19 disease will be assessed

detailed_description.textblock: In COVID-19 patients the coagulation parameters Prothrombin concentration (PC), Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time (aPTT), D Dimer, Antithrombin III (ATIII) and Fibrinogen are measured and correlation with disease severity is to be investigated

primary_outcome.measure: correlation of disease severity with results of laboratory test
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline results of coagulation profile and baseline disease severity assessment
primary_outcome.description: The results of blood coagulation profile will be correlated with degree of severity of illness

secondary_outcome.measure: Agreement of abnormalities in coagulation profile with measured inflammatory markers
secondary_outcome.description: The inflammatory markers will be measured and correlation with abnormalities in coagulation profile will be assessed

arm_group.description: Patients with confirmed COVID-19 and with mild disease
Patients with confirmed COVID-19 and with severe disease

intervention.description: Venous blood sample for measurement of blood coagulation profile

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
● Confirmed cases with COVID 19
Exclusion Criteria:
● Known history of blood coagulopathy disorder

reference.citation: Fauci AS, Lane HC, Redfield RR. Covid-19 - Navigating the Uncharted. N Engl J Med. 2020 Mar 26;382(13):1268-1269. doi: 10.1056/NEJMe2002387. Epub 2020 Feb 28.

Tang N, Li D, Wang X, Sun Z. Abnormal coagulation parameters are associated with poor prognosis in patients with novel coronavirus pneumonia. J Thromb Haemost. 2020 Apr;18(4):844-847. doi: 10.1111/jth.14768. Epub 2020 Mar 13.

Terpos E, Ntanasis-Stathopoulos I, Elalamy I, Kastritis E, Sergentanis TN, Politou M, Psaltopoulou T, Gerotziafas G, Dimopoulos MA. Hematological findings and complications of COVID-19. Am J Hematol. 2020 Jul;95(7):834-847. doi: 10.1002/ajh.25829. Epub 2020 May 23.
